Extreme angler Jeremy Wade ventures deep into Central America in search of a giant fish which is said to leap into boats and cause fatal injuries.
Alun aims for the big time but discovers the true cost of fame, and Dr Weatherill's visit to a reclusive patient unlocks deep-seated wartime memories.
A rotating panel of four female figures from the worlds of journalism and entertainment talk about various issues of importance though a woman's perspective.
Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream home renovation at little cost.
John Torode and Lisa Faulkner are back. On the Greek-inspired menu are a rack of lamb, prawn saganaki pies, moussaka and a deceptively easy baklava.
A fortune teller sees the future for the Royal staff, but Ormerod has a prediction of his own. Secrets and lies lead a local man to a drastic decision.
A fortune teller sees the future for the Royal staff, but Ormerod has a prediction of his own. Secrets and lies lead a local man to a drastic decision.
Some of the top celebrities across Ireland are interviewed while the hosts feature knowledgeable advice on topics that cover multiple topics and industries.
Buyers agent Liz O'Kane records the unfiltered realities Irish people face in the search for a home, taking a raw and honest look at the various challenges they face.
A series which chronicles the news and events of the past 20 years, all set to music. This episode looks back at the year 2004.
A look back at the hits and headlines of 2005.
Retired rugby union player Alan Quinlan speaks about his nine-year career in Ireland, during which he won 27 caps and appeared in three World Cups.
Alan Quinlan speaks about dealing with anxiety and other mental health strains during his career, which featured several highlight moments as well.
Ainsley is joined by chefs Freddy and Lerato in the kitchen garden of Blicking Hall in Norfolk for a light-hearted cooking contest.
Dating series with a fashion theme. In London, three singletons compete in a series of shopping challenges as they attempt to win the affections of musician Robert.
Roman Kemp hosts this quiz show with sidekick Sarah Greene. The contestants race on moving podiums across the studio floor to try to win £5,000.
Will, Cheryl and Scott in this edition.
Judge Judy presides over her courtroom with wit and wisdom.
Judge Judy presides over her courtroom with wit and wisdom.
A mix of celebrity interviews, entertainment news, current affairs discussions, a look at sports competitions, health columns, cooking tips and tricks, and more.

Jeremy tries to catch the rare, fearsome freshwater sawfish; a mysterious predator is reputed to reach 18 feet long, attack boats and slash humans to shreds.
Medical drama series. An innocent case of food poisoning turns out to be something more sinister.
A rotating panel of four female figures from the worlds of journalism and entertainment talk about various issues of importance though a woman's perspective.
Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream home renovation at little cost.
John Torode and Lisa Faulkner bring some classics back to the table with a fresh spin on mackerel pate and smoked salmon mousse, chicken kiev, arctic roll and a summer cocktail.
Nostalgic drama spin-off set in a hospital. Mr Rose's skills are put to the test in the field. Ken and Alun turn detective after a disastrous stag night.
Tests on a teenage boy reveal a family secret; Ormerod and Weatherill find they are under investigation; and Goodwin shows Samantha how to relax.
Some of the top celebrities across Ireland are interviewed while the hosts feature knowledgeable advice on topics that cover multiple topics and industries.
Buyers agent Liz O'Kane records the unfiltered realities Irish people face in the search for a home, taking a raw and honest look at the various challenges they face.
An examination of the top news and entertainment events of 2006 set to music.
An examination of the top news and entertainment events of 2007 set to music.
Following some of European football's top officials as they adapt to the introduction of VAR, giving their frank assessments of some of the most-talked-about decisions.
Set during the Group Stage of the 2019/20 UEFA Champions League season, Episode 2 takes a deeper dive into the psychology of refereeing.
Ainsley makes brioche French toast, chargrilled plums and cinnamon crème fraiche; Yvonne Cobb makes creamy tarragon chicken and French bean salad.
A model from London hopes to be impressed by her suitor's style choices.
Roman Kemp hosts this quiz show with sidekick Sarah Greene. The contestants race on moving podiums across the studio floor to try to win £5,000.
Graham, Deidra, David in this edition.
A dog care provider says a pet owner left their pets with her for six months; a tenant moves some of a landlord's property into a storage unit.
A man accuses a mechanic of defrauding him when he failed to put original parts as allegedly promised on his racing motorcycle.
A mix of celebrity interviews, entertainment news, current affairs discussions, a look at sports competitions, health columns, cooking tips and tricks, and more.
